body.title: Configuration file overview
body.p: The contents of the SPFE configuration file determine the behaviour of the SPFE Toolkit build system. It defines the XML elements that specify the content to include in the documentation set and the scripts to process the content to generate the output. You can use a single configuration file for the documentation set; however, unless you have a very simple documentation set, you should divide the configuration elements into a main configuration file and separate configuration files for each topic set. To maximize reuse and modularity, you use an include element to import other configuration files. The set of configuration files makes up the complete set of elements that the build system needs to build the documentation set.

SPFE provides the spfe-config.xsd configuration schema. You can define your own configuration schema, which can reuse the spfe-config.xsd schema and you can define additional elements that you need to build your documentation set. The configuration files combine to form the complete set of elements; therefore, each configuration file used to build the documentation set must follow the same configuration schema.

You should define elements that apply to the entire documentation set in the main configuration file (the file specified as a parameter when you run the spfe build tool). You can override the value of elements as needed in other configuration files.
The following elements must be defined in the main configuration file:

li.p: /spfe: This is the root element of the configuration file; each configuration file must define this element.
/spfe/doc-set: If you use a documentation set, you must define the element here.

body.p: The following elements often apply to the entire documentation set and you should specify them in the main configuration file:

li.p: /spfe/topic-type-aliases: If you want to use a user-friendly name for a topic set in the table of contents, and you have multiple topic sets that use the same topic schema, define this element in the main configuration file. The value of the /spfe/topic-aliases/topic-type/@alias attribute appears in the table of contents for the documentation set.

/spfe/wip-site: If you want to make a documentation set under development available for internal viewing, define the appropriate child elements for your test site. You need to modify the synthesis scripts to use this feature of the SPFE Toolkit.
/spfe/scripts and /spfe/sources: To avoid duplication, if one or more topic sets use the same scripts or the same content, define these elements in the main configuration file.

/spfe/output-formats: Define this element in the main configuration file if all topic sets support at least one common output format. Topic set configuration files can also define this element to add additional output formats.
/spfe/style/html-output-directories: The style sheets to format HTML output. There should be an overall style sheet and individual topic sets can define this element to add additional style sheets.

/spfe/messages: The message types the build system generates. You usually want the to view the same message type for all stages of the build. If you use the SPFE Toolkit in an automated build system, you can parse the SPFE output logs for build status information.
